frame.name: Diversity
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Group</fen> is described as having members which are similar or dissimilar to each other. The <fen>Degree</fen> of similarity may also be expressed. Some of the nouns in this frame are transparent (e.g. <ment>range.n</ment>) whereas others denote the scale of diversity (<ment>diversity</ment>); <ment>variety.n</ment> is usable both ways but is normally transparent.
<ex>The <t>diversity</t> <fex name="Group">of students here</fex> is to be applauded . <fex name="Dimension">INI</fex></ex> <ex>A <t><fex name="Group">range</fex></t> <fex name="Group">of answers</fex> were proposed .</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose diversity is at issue. </def-root>

FE.name: Dimension
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the <fen>Group</fen> is assessed.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the members of the <fen>Group</fen> are similar to each other, in general or with respect to some <fen>Dimension</fen>(s)
<ex>The songs on the album are <fex name="Degree">incredibly</fex> <t>diverse</t> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Group is diverse or homogenous.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area in which diversity occurs or exists.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which <fen>Dimension</fen> is similar or different</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>An inanimate entity or process that causes the diversity or homogeneity.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the state of the <fen>Group</fen></def-root>
